com.brightcove.player.mediacontroller

Interface BrightcoveSeekBar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BrightcoveSeekBarImpl

    public interface BrightcoveSeekBar
    Defines the operations that must be supported on a custom media controller. In general, all customization is accomplished via Android XML attributes using the standard (android) and Brightcove (bmc) namespaces. Using and Customizing: There are three areas of the Brightcove seek bar that can be customized: progress bar, scrubber and markers. The progress bar supports three new attributes, bmc:progress-color, bmc:buffering-color and bmc:remaining-color where the value is a standard Android color value. The scrubber (circle acting as a thumb handle for controlling seeking) can be disabled using the new Brightcove attribute bmc:scrubber-visibility=gone with values of visible, invisible, and gone. The scrubber color can be set using the new attribute bmc:scrubber-color. Markers can be configured with the attributes bmc:marker-color and bmc:marker-width (where the value is an integer number of pixels). Markers can be set using the SDK eventing system by emitting the event type SET_MARKERS with the event property MARKER_LIST specifying a list of integer playhead positions. To clear all markers, provide an empty list in the event property MARKER_LIST. At runtime, the standard Android seek bar can be obtained using the getSeekBar() method. And finally, at runtime, the application developer can determine if the scrubber is being dragged using the isDragging() method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String MARKER_LIST
      The event property key specifying the playhead positions at which markers should be placed.
      static java.lang.String SEEK_BAR_MAX
      The event property key for saving and restoring the seek bar max value.
      static java.lang.String SEEK_BAR_PROGRESS
      The event property key for saving and restoring the seek bar progress value.
      static java.lang.String SET_MARKERS
      Standard event type for supplying markers to the seek bar.

      boolean isDragging()
      Indicates if the seek bar is currently being dragged by a User.

      Provides an event emitter on which to set up SDK event handlers.

      • SET_MARKERS

        static final java.lang.String SET_MARKERS
        Standard event type for supplying markers to the seek bar.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MARKER_LIST

        static final java.lang.String MARKER_LIST
        The event property key specifying the playhead positions at which markers should be placed. The value must be of type: List. A missing or empty list will result in all markers being removed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isDragging

        boolean isDragging()
        Indicates if the seek bar is currently being dragged by a User.
        Returns:
        TRUE iff the User is currently dragging the seek bar scrubber.

      • setEventEmitter

        void setEventEmitter(EventEmitter eventEmitter)
        Provides an event emitter on which to set up SDK event handlers.
        Parameters:
        eventEmitter - The given SDK event emitter object.
